isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Fuel Check

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine if the engine has clean fuel for efficient engine operation.

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

step1.para: Take fuel sample from fuel tank. Fuel must be the correct grade, clean, and undiluted.

Check for air in fuel. If air is suspected, check for air leaks in the supply line to the fuel transfer pump. Install a piece of clear plastic between the filter and the transfer pump inlet. Crank the engine and check for air bubbles.

note.para: Cold weather can cause fuel waxing in some grades of diesel fuel. Waxing will restrict or stop fuel flow through the fuel filter.

step1.para: Check for gasoline or kerosene in the diesel fuel.
If engine oil is in the fuel, injector O-ring leaks and lower injection control pressure are likely. If these conditions are suspected, do the following:

step2.para: Drain some fuel from the fuel filter and check fuel color. If fuel sample is dark, compare the sample to the correct grade of uncontaminated fuel.

If the comparison is inconclusive, remove the fuel filter. Use a filter cutter to cut and expose the filter element. If the element is black, oil may have entered the fuel system past injector O-rings.

note.para: If fuel quality is good, but the engine will not start, depress priming valve plunger. If the plunger has no resistance, the fuel system is out of fuel. Do Fuel Pump Pressure Test (Test 14) to check fuel pressure.

item.para: The in-line fuel valve (if equipped) could be shut off.
Fuel supply line could be broken or crimped.
The tank pickup tube could be clogged or cracked.
Supplemental filters or water separators may be plugged or leaking allowing air to enter the fuel system.
Water or contaminants in fuel tank.
Fuel grade may not be suitable for cold temperatures.
Fuel could be waxed or jelled (usually Grade 2-D).
